item.title: /Solved
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

you should familiarize with your operators.

Is not checking whether the the value of x is set to true, so the condition does not have a value. Instead what you’re doing is you’re assigning the value of x from side to side.

[sub]a = b + c.[/sub]

Taking the value of a and b and putting it into c. http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/opsummary.html In java, a boolean can only have two values which are true and false, hence why you have to use the == operand to check the flag conditions.

Read full topic

@Sup22211 wrote:

Did you just added this?

check if its setting the boolean to false anywhere else.
EDIT: I just noticed that,:
Its should be like this no?
case 39132:
if(c.skillLock[0] == true){//NOTICE THE ==
c.skillLock[0] = false;
c.sendMessage("<shad=13697024>Your Attack XP is Now Unlocked");
c.getPA().sendFrame126(“Lock Attack”, 10116);
//c.getPA().updateLocks();
}else{

                                    c.skillLock[0] = true;
                                    c.sendMessage("<shad=13697024>Your Attack XP is Now Locked</shad>");
                                    c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@Unlock Attack", 10116);
                                    //c.getPA().updateLocks();
                            }
                    break;

and add this to be sure:
}else{
if(c.skillLock[0] == false){//ADD THIS TO BE SURE.
c.skillLock[0] = true;
c.sendMessage("<shad=13697024>Your Attack XP is Now Locked");
c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@Unlock Attack", 10116);
//c.getPA().updateLocks();
}
Good luck

item.title: /Solved
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[s]I’ve never done something as complex as this before. Nor do I want to hand out ALL my code, as it’s something I came up with 100% unique and on my own. Granted you need the interface to get it working.
So I’m adding a custom skill lock system to my server. With that, I added 25 (24?) booleans to my server. one for each skill.
I haven’t got them all working, yet.
In order for them to work, the booleans need to update in real time, and I noticed that they never actually update what so ever. They stay set to false, even if I manually change them in the player file.

Here’s one of the buttons in my clickingbuttons.java:

			case 39132:
				if(c.skillLock[0] = true){
					c.skillLock[0] = false;
					c.sendMessage("<shad=13697024>Your Attack XP is Now Unlocked</shad>");
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("Lock Attack", 10116);
					//c.getPA().updateLocks();
				}else{
					c.skillLock[0] = true;
					c.sendMessage("<shad=13697024>Your Attack XP is Now Locked</shad>");
					c.getPA().sendFrame126("@red@Unlock Attack", 10116);
					//c.getPA().updateLocks();
				}
			break;

See, it’s supposed to set it to either true, or false. But it doesn’t.

For more help, here’s a video showing the error:
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=buDgVuKOf58[/youtube]
I had just added the buttons for Magic and Cooking. That’s why they were red at the time of capturing.

Need more explanation/code?
Ask.[/s]

Read full topic
